bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Helen and Abby H. Price, 6 October 1876
bibl.orgName: The Pierpont Morgan Library, New York, N.Y.

revisionDesc.change: extracted transcription from Major Authors cd

body.p: I am still jogging along here—still just holding on—sometimes (perhaps a quarter of the time) tolerably fair—the rest, by the skin of my teeth—but upon the whole with a spirit of cheerfulness & content with what comes that quite surprises myself.

My new edition 2 VolsVolumes is out & bound, & pictured & autographed. I sell a few, mostly to England—gives me a little occupation—got your letter—write again—believe me, Helen and Abby dear, I appreciate the letters, & most of all your persistent & faithful friendship.
